title: Kapp hat-trick shoots down Stars in WBBL
text:
Marizanne Kapp has jagged the fourth hat-trick in WBBL history to spearhead the Sydney Sixers to a convincing eight-wicket victory over the Melbourne Stars at Hurstville Oval.

South African seamer Kapp (3-16) tore through the Stars' lower order on Saturday with her last three deliveries in the 19th over, skittling Madeline Penna and Nicola Hancock before trapping Holly Ferling lbw.

"I was actually really happy we bowled first," Kapp said.

"I felt it was a slow wicket.

"It was not my best bowling, to be honest, but I'll take it."

Kapp remained stony-faced while her Sixers teammates celebrated wildly as the Stars suffered an 8-19 collapse. They had started promisingly at 1-77 before finishing on 9-107, which the Sixers reeled in with 17 balls to spare.

Kapp's wife, teammate and fellow South African Dane van Niekerk, who was the last Sixer to take a hat-trick, snared 2-18.

The other two WBBL hat-tricks belong to Gemma Triscari and Amy Satterthwaite.

Another Protea, Mignon du Preez (44), was the only Star batter to get going after skipper Elyse Villani had struggled for timing at the beginning of the afternoon with a painstaking 14.

When du Preez departed after being stranded mid-pitch, the Stars went into freefall.

In reply, Alyssa Healy (27) belted two sixes to start the chase aggressively and Ash Gardner (32) continued Healy's early work before holing out.

Skipper Ellyse Perry (39 not out) dropped the anchor early before branching out late, calmly pacing a run chase that was never in doubt.
description: Marizanne Kapp has jagged the fourth hat-trick in WBBL history to spearhead the Sydney Sixers to a convincing eight-wicket victory over the Melbourne Stars...
